response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line an 8‑inch round cake pan with parchment paper and grease lightly with butter or non‑stick spray. This ensures an even bake and easy release of the cake once it cools, preventing sticking and maintaining a smooth finish and firm, gentle crumb integrity for baking.",
  "step2": "In a large mixing bowl, sift together 1½ cups of all‑purpose flour, ¾ cup of unsweetened cocoa powder, 2 cups of granulated sugar, 1½ teaspoons of baking soda, ¾ teaspoon of baking powder, and a pinch of sea salt. These ingredients form the base of the moist batter for mixing.",
  "step3": "Whisk together 2 eggs, ¾ cup of vegetable oil, 1 cup of buttermilk, and 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract until the mixture is smooth and glossy. Fold in 1 cup of hot tap water to activate the cocoa and ensure a rich, chocolate‑laden batter for smooth ideal dessert moments today.",
  "step4": "Pour batter into prepared pan, placing it center‑aligned on the middle rack of the preheated oven. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out mostly dry with a few moist crumbs. Let it cool for five minutes before stunning final presentation today.",
  "step5": "While the cake rests, whisk together 2 cups of creamy buttercream, ¾ cup of unsweetened cocoa powder, ¼ cup of powdered sugar, ¾ teaspoon of espresso powder, and a splash of milk until a silky, spreadable glaze forms. Chill for fifteen minutes to thicken before applying generously with extra cream.",
  "step6": "Spoon thick frosting over the cooled cake, smoothing it into a subtle dome shape. Trim any excess with a small knife to create a neat edge. Refrigerate for 20 minutes to set, then dust lightly with cocoa powder and serve chilled to delight eight guests and savor it joyfully today."
}
